text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses California litigation and cites the relevant procedural code section for broad discovery. Under the 'California Risks' subsection, it states: \"CCP \u00a72017.010 Expansive Discovery: Discovery extends to 'any matter, not privileged, that is relevant to the subject matter involved in the pending action or to the claim or defense of any party.'\" This directly satisfies the requirement of identifying California litigation under the California Code of Civil Procedure (CCP sections 2016-2036) for broad discovery.", "criterion_id": "7ab189fa-1225-4153-930e-3dd8f1e26685"}
